content.question: At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a bank account that earns <math alttext="4 percent sign"><mn>4</mn><mo>%</mo></math> annual interest contains <math alttext="$ 100"><mo>$</mo><mn>100</mn></math>. The amount of money, in dollars, in the account can be modeled by the exponential function <math alttext="v"><mi>v</mi></math> given by <math alttext="v open parentheses t close parentheses equals 100 open parentheses 1.04 close parentheses to the power of t"><mi>v</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>1.04</mn></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></math>, with time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> measured in years. How many years would it take for the value of the account to increase from <math alttext="$ 200"><mo>$</mo><mn>200</mn></math> to <math alttext="$ 300"><mo>$</mo><mn>300</mn></math> ? Assume that no money was taken out of the account, and no additional money besides interest was added to the account.

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
